newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Italy's Stet in group eyeing Brazil telecom stake.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Stet in group eyeing Brazil telecom stake.

text.p: Italy's Stet SpA, Argentina's Perez Companc SA and two local firms formed a consortium to bid on a 35 percent stake in a Brazilian state telephone company, officials said.

Camargo Correa and Bradesco are the locals in the group planning to partake in November's auction of shares of Rio Grande do Sul state's Companhia Riograndense de Telecomunicacoes SA (CRT), a statement from the consortium said.
Analysts see the sale as a litmus test for the upcoming privatization of Brazil's giant federally owned Telebras

Meanwhile, France Telecom, local bank Opportunity, Banco do Brasil's investment arm and three Brazilian state pension funds are negotiating to form a consortium to bid on the CRT stake, an official said.
William Bezerra Cavalcanti Filho, executive manager of Banco do Brasil Investimentos, said the pension funds are Telos, Sistel and Previ.
A state spokeswoman said last month that Stet International SpA and six other foreign-led groups, made up of firms from Asia, Brazil, Europe and the United States, had prequalified for the auction.

The groups include France Cables et Radio of France, GTE International Telecommunications with GTE Corp of the U.S., Korea Telecom of South Korea, Japan's Nippon Telegraph & Telephone Co. with Itochu Corp and Cia Suzano de Papel e Celulose of Brazil.
Also prequalified are Telefonica Internacional de Espana of Spain with Brazil's RBS Participacoes SA and Chile's Cia Telecomunicaciones de Chile, and Sweden's Telia Overseas AB and Brazil's Partech.
